Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Antagonize \An*tag"o*nize\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Antagonized}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Antagonozing}.] [Gr. ?. See {Antagonism}.] To contend with; to oppose actively; to counteract. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Antagonize \An*tag"o*nize\, v. i. To act in opposition. [1913 Webster]
antagonize v 1: provoke the hostility of; "Don't antagonize your boss" [syn: {antagonise}] 2: act in opposition to [syn: {antagonise}, {counteract}]
